questDatabase.name: Your first night
questDatabase.description: You first task will be to find food, and a shelter for the night. The nights will be cruel, as this pack has Hardcore Darkness. It probably would be a good idea to collect some food now...

questDatabase.name: Where is the flint?
questDatabase.description: As you might have noticed, while collecting gravel, no flint dropped for you. Well, there is an... recipe for that. Look up flint in NEI and craft some!

questDatabase.name: Sticks 'n Stones
questDatabase.description: This book as a built-in reading light, lucky you! Most probably you will read this text while you are waiting for the night to be over. Once it is, go out and collect some gravel and wood. Keep in mind that you need food, so look for Pam's Harvestcraft gardens. (And save some of the vegetables for seeds!)

questDatabase.name: Storage for days
questDatabase.description: Now that you've unlocked 3x3 crafting, it's about time to make some storage for your goods. Take some of your wood, and craft a chest. You will need 4 wood, 4 planks and 1 flint.

questDatabase.name: Crafting time
questDatabase.description: It's time to get yourself a 3x3 crafting area. Grab some flint and some wood, and build one!

questDatabase.name: Tools
questDatabase.description: Now that you've got a shelter, crafting table and a place to store your items, you should make some tools. (Unless you'd like to continue punching trees with your bare hand...)

questDatabase.name: You reap...
questDatabase.description: You won't always get food rewards from this book, so it might be a good idea to take care of that problem. As you've created a hoe already, go and find some water nearby and make a field. Let's trade some sticks for a carrot, so you can start your farm.

questDatabase.name: ...what you sow
questDatabase.description: If you, by chance, did read the previous quest and planted the carrot I gave you, then you're fine. Meanwhile, you should turn some more fruits and vegetables into seeds, and increase your farm to get a steady supply of food.

questDatabase.name: Get that stone
questDatabase.description: Look at you, with your shiny flint pickaxe! Time to mine some cobblestone. Yay! (And maybe you can improve this dirt-hut too...)

questDatabase.name: Fire, fire, Grandpa!
questDatabase.description: Time to burn some stuff, isn't it? You can't make charcoal in it, but you sure will find some usage for it soon(tm).

questDatabase.name: Rest in pieces
questDatabase.description: It's GLOPPing time! Go kill some pigs to gather meat. (And yes, they will drop cooked porkchop. Now if that isn't useful...)

questDatabase.name: Sharpness: Over... 5...
questDatabase.description: It's about time to craft some more useful stuff: A sword!

questDatabase.name: Fluffy and red
questDatabase.description: Epic quest: Kill some sheep! (And try to get some wool, for a bed, obviously...)

questDatabase.name: SO...TIRED...MUST...SLEEP...
questDatabase.description: Sleepy time, and: The end of Tier 0. Congratulations, you've built yourself your first hideout, and you should have a steady supply of food by now. See you again in Tier 1!

questDatabase.name: What is that...?
questDatabase.description: You've seen a lot of trees, but there are a few that look really special. You are sure that these trees are more than just wood to build your home or get charcoal.

questDatabase.name: Ready, set, go!
questDatabase.description: You probably should have a home by now. A steady supply of food is a fundamental requirement at all times. Take this journal to keep track of the things you've eaten, while you proceed. You will have to travel far in this Tier, better be prepared!

questDatabase.name: Better Tank... Iron Tank
questDatabase.description:
Storing more than 16 Buckets of Fluids in one tank? Sure just make an iron Tank or upgrade the Buildcraft Tank.
Diamond Tanks carry up to 64 Buckets and Obsidian ones are blast proof.

questDatabase.name: Sand: The Gathering
questDatabase.description: In a strange vision you saw a big structure which would allow you to make charcoal. Finally some torches! According to your calculations, you would need a lot of sand for that.

questDatabase.name: Basic processing
questDatabase.description: Most things are unavailable at the moment, so lets begin with something simple. Take some of your cobblestone and smelt it into regular stone. And because this modpack is evil, you'll need to use wood for that. How much fun is that!

questDatabase.name: Maceration v0.1 Alpha
questDatabase.description: This fancy little device works (almost...) like a macerator. Some people say it's even better, since it does not require power, yay! You only need to craft one for this quest, but you probably should do some more if you can...

questDatabase.name: Gravel: The Gathering
questDatabase.description: Your tools will eventually loose durability. You think it would be a good idea to collect more gravel in order to provide yourself with flint for more tools.

questDatabase.name: Clay: The Gathering
questDatabase.description: While being bored, you thought that it might be a good idea to kill your time with pottery. You should go and find some clay, riverbanks should have some.

questDatabase.name: Finite Water!?
questDatabase.description: Finite Water is a problem, that's for sure. But last night, you had an idea. If you can drink cacti, you should also be able to use it for most recipes that require water. How cool is that? So what about another trade; 10 Wood for.. 3 Cacti so you can setup a farm. Deal?

questDatabase.name: Something to carry liquids
questDatabase.description: You tried to move water with you bare hands, which didn't work at all. Luckily, you remember a way how to make a buckets out of clay.

questDatabase.name: Getting (char)coal
questDatabase.description: It's time to get yourself some charcoal. For that, we're going to build a coke oven. Good that you just collected a lot of resources! (What a coincidence...)

questDatabase.name: Another brick in the wall
questDatabase.description: Your vision becomes more clear, you'll need bricks for your first multiblock structure. You think that 104 bricks should be enough. However, the bricks you'll need are somewhat special. Pay attention to craft the correct ones!

questDatabase.name: Forming press v0.1
questDatabase.description: As you might have noticed, you cannot turn clay into bricks as usual. Well, to be fair, it wasn't a good recipe anyway. You'll probably end up with something bread-shaped. So in order to make bricks, you need a form. Get yourself a knife and a blank pattern, and cut a brick sized piece out. As easy as that.

questDatabase.name: Finally, some power
questDatabase.description: Now that you have a coke oven, you should start producing charcoal. The more, the better. Don't worry about the creosote oil; I have another deal for you...

questDatabase.name: Copper sky, Iron curtain
questDatabase.description: With your new acquired fuel source, you are now ready to process more advanced materials than stone or clay; Iron or copper, for example. Just in case you don't know, they spawn in rather large veins. Use the following quests to search and locate the most important veins you'll need.

questDatabase.name: Another fuel source
questDatabase.description: Lignite and regular coal is the fuel source you'll definitely need; as the latter can be turned into coke, which is a superior material to smelt your first large batch of Ore.

questDatabase.name: Copper
questDatabase.description: Can be found between 5 and 60 either as "Copper Ore" or "Chalcopyrite". Most of the time you'll find it together with  "Iron" and "Pyrite".

questDatabase.name: Tin
questDatabase.description: Found mostly in Mountains, between y 60 and 220. Also the veins are a source of "Cassiterite".

questDatabase.name: Book parts
questDatabase.description: After you've found a way to pick up and move around water, you had another brilliant idea: Paper! Usually made with Sugarcane, which doesn't work any more (And is pretty weird anyway...). However, you will need a lot of wood to craft wood pulp, so better grab your Axe and go choppin' some trees.

questDatabase.name: Tinker-time
questDatabase.description: While using your flint tools is fun in terms of burning pigs and cows, they are not pretty good, and can't be repaired. You had an idea how to craft tools that could be repaired and upgraded, but for that you definitely need some more advanced crafting technique.

questDatabase.name: Aluminini...um...?
questDatabase.description: Whatever it is spelled, you will need it. Mostly found on the surface. Try to search in rivers. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Making bronze
questDatabase.description: Now that you've found copper and tin, you should make yourself some bronze. Use your macer... mortar to grind up some copper and tin, and mix them together!

questDatabase.name: Important tools
questDatabase.description:
In order to craft even the basic machines, you'll need new tools. Most of them can be replaced by machines later. For now, you should make yourself familiar with each of their recipes, as you will need a lot of these tools, starting from today.

Also your new tools can be used to make Railcraft water tanks, a quite useful thing considering the finite water feature.

questDatabase.name: Getting iron
questDatabase.description: With your new bronze tools, you are able to mine most of the Overworld Ores. I think you already found Iron or Magnetite.  So bring me some Ores and make some Iron Ingots out of them.

questDatabase.name: Making better tools
questDatabase.description:
With Aluminium and Copper, you can create a pretty durable material "Aluminium Brass", which can be used to cast better tools. These can be used to mine some more advanced ores.

But first you need a Smeltery. Go to Multi Block Chapter or find Smeltery Blocks in a Village nearby.

questDatabase.name: Better storage
questDatabase.description: As crafting chests is a good idea for your basic items and goods, it is not for the vast amount of ores. You should build yourself some barrels in order to keep things organized.

questDatabase.name: You shall proceed
questDatabase.description: As you've gathered and crafted all materials and tools you need for your basic steam machinery, you may now proceed to the next tier. Keep in mind that you'll need mountains of resources in order to craft even the simplest things, so you probably should stock up on all ores in this tier. But that's up to you.

questDatabase.name: Don't burn your fingers!
questDatabase.description:
You have decided its time to make some tasty pizza, but your fingers got burned badly. Reading an ancient cookbook you discover a magical item that would allow you to carry anything hot, even lava in a bucket.

The Gloves have to be placed in the Baubles Ring slots from Thaumcraft.

questDatabase.name: Cow Tripper
questDatabase.description: Before you had to kill some Pigs and Sheep's to complete quests. Now it's time to kill some Cows and hopefully get some Leather. If you are lucky and get a Cow Trophy you may never need to kill any Cow in the future.

questDatabase.name: Cotton, cotton and more cotton
questDatabase.description: You find out that cotton is very useful. You can make wool out of it (how you can do this seems magical). Strings can be made out of cotton, and some other useful items too. Make some small cotton plantation to get more of this useful stuff.

questDatabase.name: Welcome to Tier 1
questDatabase.description: Welcome and well done so far! This tier is all about your first machines, getting more stuff from your ores and making bronze ingots in more efficient.

questDatabase.name: Multiblock Tanks... Railcraft Tanks
questDatabase.description: 576 Buckets of Fluids... Enough to store all the Creosote I made before. If this isn't enough I can make this Tank bigger. The smallest tanks are 3x3x4 while the biggest are 9x9x8 blocks.

questDatabase.name: More advanced alloys
questDatabase.description: Your smeltery does a great job in mixing metals into alloys, but it's not very efficient, and limited in its complexity. You need something new, so why not put your steam to some use? It might also come in handy when processing raw rubber.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: High speed alloys
questDatabase.description: Like most machines, there is a more advanced version of the alloy smelter. Keep in mind that this machine uses a lot of steam, so you better get some more boilers first. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: A very important alloy
questDatabase.description: Basically the most important alloy (until you reach a higher tier) is without questioning, red alloy. Fortunately, you have an alloy smelter, so better grab some redstone and get yourself a handful of that.

questDatabase.name: The hell is that?
questDatabase.description: In order to get more machines, you'll need pistons. But not those amateurish ones, you need special ones, and I shall guide you how to make those.

questDatabase.name: Macerator v1.0!
questDatabase.description: Finally you are able to get a device, that will replace your mortar. However, the "no-durability" feature of this device comes with a cost: You need 2 diamonds for the grinding heads.

questDatabase.name: Extracting stuff
questDatabase.description: As you'll need rubber later on in order to wrap wires into cables, you should get yourself a steam extractor. You can also use this machine to get more dyes from flowers, or process different fruits into juice.

questDatabase.name: A clear view
questDatabase.description: Still living in your dirt/cobblestone bunker? What about some windows? Put some sand in your smeltery, and pour it into a casting basin to make clear glass. In order to use it for recipes, you have to macerate it and then smelt it in any furnace.

questDatabase.name: Hammer time v2
questDatabase.description: Using 6 ingots to craft a hammer seems to be pretty wasteful, as these tools use up durability. How nice would it be to have machine that does the same but without having durability? Guess what, there is one! And you should totally get one.

questDatabase.name: Compressing stuff
questDatabase.description: This rather simple device does a very important job: compressing stuff. As you are not able to get blocks just by pressing 9 ingots with your bare hands, it is also useful to do various additional tasks, for example making firm tofu.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Better compressor
questDatabase.description: An updated version of the steam compressor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Forge hammer
questDatabase.description: An updated version of the steam forge hammer. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Extractor
questDatabase.description: An updated version of the steam extractor. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. You most probably want to craft this, as the extractor does also extract your nerves... (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Better macerator
questDatabase.description: An updated version of the steam macerator. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Steam alternatives
questDatabase.description: There is more than one way to get steam for your machines. This completely optional quests shall show you some ways of getting steam.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Coal boiler
questDatabase.description: This is basically just an upgrade to your current coal boiler, however it produces more than twice as much steam. Something you should consider building if you're planning to get some of the machine upgrades.

questDatabase.name: Another use for Java, I mean Lava
questDatabase.description: With the more durable steel casings, you can now use lava to make steam.

questDatabase.name: The power of the sun
questDatabase.description: The sun has quite a bit of power, so why not use it to produce steam?

questDatabase.name: Using steam to cook things
questDatabase.description: A rather slow process, but it's more efficient than using a regular furnace.

questDatabase.name: Upgrade: Better furnace
questDatabase.description: An updated version of the steam furnace. Uses more steam, but is almost twice as fast. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Blastoff!
questDatabase.description: It's about time to make some steel. Look in the multiblock quest set and build a bronze blast furnace. Return here when you made at least 8 steel ingots.

questDatabase.name: Time for some logic
questDatabase.description: Good news is: You are now able to advance to the next tier! Bad news is: You still have to craft a lot of things before you can begin. But fear not mortal, I shall guide you!

questDatabase.name: Wired, weird?!
questDatabase.description: One of the very basic materials which you should memorize how to craft are wires and cables. Basically you just cut a plate into a wire with your wire cutter. Not very efficient, but there will be a better way later.

questDatabase.name: Your first logic circuit
questDatabase.description: Where steam machines are kinda stupid and just do one thing again and again, as you advance into electrical age, you've decided that you want the machines to have more features, like auto-output in order to create some automation. For that, you need logic circuits.

questDatabase.name: Wire-Wrap
questDatabase.description: Placing wires without insulation seems to be a bad idea. Now that you have an extractor to extract raw rubber out of sticky resin and an alloy smelter to further process it using sulphur, you should work on getting some rubber sheets.

questDatabase.name: Steam-a-licious!
questDatabase.description: You almost made it. One last crafting step is required in order to advance to Tier 2. Keep going!

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Motors
questDatabase.description: Motors are little devices that can turn electrical power into rotational energy. Very useful for all kind of machines, and not that difficult to craft. The pattern is always the same, only the materials change with tiers.

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Rotors
questDatabase.description: Rotors are also crafted using identical pattern with different materials. Annoying to craft a bit at the moment, but you don't need a lot of them anyway.

questDatabase.name: Basic crafting: Casings
questDatabase.description: All machines need a hull to keep their private parts together. Good news is: They are crafted in the same way for every tier, only the materials change.

questDatabase.name: You are not prepared!!!
questDatabase.description: It's time for something really big: A smeltery! There's a lot to craft, so better gather some resources...

questDatabase.name: The water dilemma
questDatabase.description: Finite water is a problem. But fear not, there are solutions! I shall guide you to get a steady supply of water.

questDatabase.name: Time to get some steel
questDatabase.description:
You need steel? Uhh... fine. Let's get busy...

(Hint: Bronze Blast Furnace can share Walls with other ones, just like most GT multi blocks. How will this affect the air quality though...)

questDatabase.name: EBF-Time
questDatabase.description:
In order to get the proper alumin(i)um, you need an electrical blast furnace. It's another very important step towards victory, so let's get started.

Getting the heating coils might be tricky...

(You need 2LV hatches with 4A LV total, or 3LV hatches with MOOOORE power if the multiblock is not fully fixed)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #1: More heat
questDatabase.description: Better materials need higher temperatures. You can just exchange the old coils with the new ones. You can even recycle the old coils, how fancy is that!

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #2: Higher tier
questDatabase.description: To reach the 3600k heat capacity of your EBF, so you can process high-tier materials like Tungsten, you need Nichrome heating coils.

questDatabase.name: Compress all the things
questDatabase.description: Martin's (DreamMasterXXL) favourite machine. Compress ALL the things! With explosives, of course.

questDatabase.name: At the end of...
questDatabase.description: ...universe everything freezes eventually. But waiting for the heat death of universe might take too long. Therefore we present you the vacuum freezer. It should be good enough to cool your hot stuff.

questDatabase.name: An unexpected Bonus
questDatabase.description: Because we're nice Developers, we decided to add a little bonus if you happen to compress charcoal. Not only enables it to process more than 16 steel at a time (not in the Bronze Blast Furnace), it also yields 10x the burn time per block instead of 9x. So one charcoal for free. This bonus only occurs on the first compression step. (But for fanciness, you should definitely get a Quintuple one!)

questDatabase.name: High speed charcoal
questDatabase.description: Sure, those coke ovens are nice, but there aren't even remotely fast enough to keep up with a large steam boiler. Luckily, there is an upgrade available! The creosote oil will not be produced, but the process will speed up the dramatically. Who needs that nasty yellowish stuff anyway...

questDatabase.name: Where I can put all the Liquids in
questDatabase.description: With your brand new Alloy Smelter you are able to combine two materials. What happens if you mix some Obsidian Dust and Glass? Obsidian Glass, great. Your first tank that you can make would be a Buildcraft Tank. This tank can carry up 16 Buckets of a single fluid. It is possible to upgrade those tanks so they can hold up to 64 Buckets.

questDatabase.name: Smelt all the things...
questDatabase.description: ...with this great invention! Uses power to smelt up to 2 stacks of items at once! Can't go any faster! (Parallel smelting depends on coils, consult your doctor before use)

questDatabase.name: Upgrade #3: Upgrade Tier 4
questDatabase.description: To process more advanced Materials like: Enderium, Enriched Naquadah or Niobium-Titanium you need more than 3600K. Upgrade your EBF... again.

questDatabase.name: Steel Multiblock Tanks
questDatabase.description: Want to double the amount of Liquid a tank can hold. Sure make a Steel Tank. All sizes allowed from 3x3x4 to 9x9x8 blocks.

questDatabase.name: Welcome to Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Why, hello there! Seems you've made it into electrical age. But behold, do not throw away your steam machines. You'll probably want to use them until you reach Tier 3.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3
questDatabase.description: In Tier 3, you will be able to craft your first actually "useful" machines. Basic ones do the job, but with MV, a lot more recipes will unlock. Your goal here is to reach a stable ore processing for the vast amounts of materials you'll need for later on. You also should focus on power production if you haven't already.

questDatabase.name: Damn you, wire cutter!
questDatabase.description: Enough is enough. No more wasting of gazillions of ingots just for a couple of wires. Now that you have power, you should go for a wiremill!

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #1
questDatabase.description: The first item you'll need a lot of. If you want to pull items out of Chests or Barrels you need one (Goes pretty well with item pipes or GT machines, adjust with screwdriver).

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #4
questDatabase.description: The third item you'll need a lot of, and is also a pain to craft. Probably, the most painful item ever (Works like conveyor but can work with selected item slots, adjust with screwdriver).

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #2
questDatabase.description: The second item you'll need a lot of. When you want to get the Fluid out of the Thanks you need one (Goes pretty well with fluid pipes or GT machines, adjust with screwdriver, it can also be further upgraded into fluid regulator that allows precise control of fluid transfer speed).

questDatabase.name: Electric macerator
questDatabase.description: It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to macerate something is a lot better when using EU.

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #3
questDatabase.description: A piston, but more .. "Electrical". The 4th item you are going to craft a lot in the future.

questDatabase.name: Saving redstone
questDatabase.description: Tired of using 4 redstone for one magnetic Iron rod? Well, good news for you! The polarizer doesn't need redstone, just a little bit of power. You don't need to attach this machine to a permanent power source, it runs fine on battery power.

questDatabase.name: Avengers, assemble!
questDatabase.description: An absolute must have for fans of the movie. Oh, and to make all the things, of course.

questDatabase.name: No more filing
questDatabase.description: Why wasting a full ingot to make a rod, that needs a tool which looses durability and takes even more ingots? With this little device, all your rod-needs shall be fulfilled (for now).

questDatabase.name: Bzzz... Whoom...
questDatabase.description: Making Etched Wired for Good Circuits need a Precision Laser Engraver.

questDatabase.name: Press all the things
questDatabase.description: If you want to make Basic circuits more efficiently you can using the Forming Press. But for the Good Circuits you need  it.

questDatabase.name: Mjolnir!!! (Electric forge hammer)
questDatabase.description: Not really required, but it is a lot faster than the steam one and it can be automated. If you feel like ore washing is too slow use this hammer. There are no recipes that require anything more than steam level to hammer something.

questDatabase.name: Cutting things apart
questDatabase.description: An absolutely mandatory machine to have. It will cut rods into bolts, plates into casings, logs into planks, and of that will be done with the highest possible efficiency. Totally worth it!

questDatabase.name: Get ready for Tier 3
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed forward, you need to get Aluminium. A lot of it. But for now, one is enough to unlock this quest. Probably the best source for Aluminium is clay, but you need a MV machine for that. So you need to find an alternative until you have enough dusts for your initial setup.

questDatabase.name: Your magic progression
questDatabase.description: Now that you are able to produce Aluminium, you may dig into magic. If you haven't unlocked basic thaumaturgy, try to find a silverwood and a greatwood sapling.

questDatabase.name: The missing one
questDatabase.description: It was once said... <basdxz> But ffs, add a plate bender to the LV tier book ...and then it popped into existence.

questDatabase.name: Your first automation
questDatabase.description: Well, probably not the first, but definitely something big! You will need a cart assembler in the first place.

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Power
questDatabase.description: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered via solar or lava. But for now you have to use a simple coal engine.

questDatabase.name: Automated (un-)loading
questDatabase.description: You can fill and empty your cart manually, but it's a lot more convenient to automate item transfer, isn't it?

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Farming
questDatabase.description: Unfortunately, the basic farmer can't farm anything besides wheat. It's not expensive at all, and probably the cheapest solution to give your automated food production a boost.

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Storage
questDatabase.description: A basic cart can't hold any items, so you need to attach chests to it.

questDatabase.name: A simple cart
questDatabase.description: In order to create or customize your cart you need a hull to attach your desired upgrades to. Wooden one can be used for really simple applications, but to farm wheat or wood, you need at least an iron one.

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Wood cutter
questDatabase.description: The basic wood cutter will break after a while, but you never have to replace it. It can be simply repaired with diamonds.

questDatabase.name: Basic transport pipe
questDatabase.description: These pipes are rather simple and won't do anything on their own. But in combination with Transfer Nodes, you'll soon find out how great they are. Also, given the correct upgrades, they even surpass most other transfer systems.

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Items
questDatabase.description: In order to transfer items, you need so called "nodes". There are some for pushing items into a pipe system, and later you'll have access to nodes that are able to pull items from attached inventories.

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Fluids
questDatabase.description: Just like item nodes, liquid nodes transfer... liquids. But probably the best thing: They can all utilize the same transfer pipe!

questDatabase.name: Alloy Smelter
questDatabase.description: Upgrade your Steam Alloy Smelter to LV one.

questDatabase.name: Gotta catch 'em all
questDatabase.description: Sure, you can use wheat/potatoes/carrots to make animals follow you back to your base, but that can be tedious. A golden lasso is a proper solution for that.

questDatabase.name: Basic monster protection
questDatabase.description: Spawning monsters in or near your base can be annoying. Especially if you happen to get infernal creepers. Luckily, there is a way to prevent them to spawn at all.

questDatabase.name: A quite different storage
questDatabase.description: Regular chests can fill up rather quickly if you happen to collect mob drops like swords and/or armor. By using a cabinet, you can store up to 270 items of the same type.

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 1
questDatabase.description: One needs proper protection for his home. So why not get some turrets for safety? At the moment, 2 Turrets are available; "Potato" and "disposable item". I assume you can guess what they do and how they work...

questDatabase.name: Passive defence
questDatabase.description: A more "passive" approach to base defence are walls and fences. But seriously, where is the fun?

questDatabase.name: Turret base
questDatabase.description: Turrets must be placed on top of a turret base. Only the player who initially placed the base can access and configure the turret. So don't worry about people taking your ammunition.

questDatabase.name: Who needs that dirt anyway
questDatabase.description: You probably have a ton of items floating around in your base. So why not use it to kill enemies?

questDatabase.name: Don't play with food!
questDatabase.description: Use it to kill Zombies instead. Does only little damage, but hey, who cares?

questDatabase.name: Upgrading intensifies
questDatabase.description: Your turrets probably need more space to hold more ammunition, so why not get an upgrade for that?

questDatabase.name: Electrolysing all the things
questDatabase.description: Collected a lot of dusts since you started with macerating, washing and centrifuging ores? Until now you couldn't separate them. It's time to get all the pure and valuable materials out of them.

questDatabase.name: Project Red Begging
questDatabase.description:
First of all there are 3 types of pipes: Null Logic , Pressurized and Routed.
-Null Logic are the most basic kind they can't have any logical thinking , Item transport pipes are from this category and they are used to craft and connect the Routed and Pressurized pipes it would be a wise choice to craft some extras.
 
-Routed pipes are the most advanced they can communicate with eachother in order to create pipe networks, and can be used for very complex tasks.
 
-Presuirezed pipes and too complicated to use and explain you won't need them anyway since you can use the routed ones to do anything you want.

However in order to control the logic of the routed pipes you will need chips.

questDatabase.name: Ender not-so-IO
questDatabase.description: You've probably used EnderIO before. It's quite useful for a lot of things. But a lot of stuff has changed here, so let's start from scratch.

questDatabase.name: Machine chassis
questDatabase.description: All EnderIO machines still require the basic chassis, and it's almost the same recipe as before; Except that you need plates instead of ingots. But that shouldn't be a problem at all...

questDatabase.name: Portable tanks
questDatabase.description: Until now, you where required to use buildcraft tanks to carry liquids around. Which can be a pain to do. These little tanks are able to push and pull liquids by themselves, as they have a build in pump which is powered by some magic energy source. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Simple RF-Power: Solid
questDatabase.description: By simply burning coal as fuel, this machine produces RF power. Enough for a basic machine setup. (Still GT wiring and transformers can transform EU to RF)

questDatabase.name: Simple RF-Power: Liquids
questDatabase.description: This generator requires both water as coolant, and a burnable liquid such as fuel. The amount of power it produces depends on the liquid used.

questDatabase.name: The power of enderman
questDatabase.description: Elevators are nice, but they are limited to vertical teleportation, and their range is also somewhat limited. TravelAnchors do not have that limitation you can teleport from one Anchor to any other within range. You can name them and even set them as private.

questDatabase.name: Conduits
questDatabase.description: Probably the most awesome way to transport just anything in multiple different ways. Get some of each type.

questDatabase.name: Yet another wrench
questDatabase.description: The Yeta Wrench is more than just a regular wrench. While holding it, you are able to switch between conduit types, eventually allowing you remove one specific conduit type from a bundle of many. Ctrl-Mousewheel will switch modes, also Shift-Leftclick allows you to open the configuration interface even if you don't have access to that side of the conduit.

questDatabase.name: Improving conduits
questDatabase.description: Conduits on their own are pretty awesome, but you can do better. By using filters and speed upgrades, you gain even more control over what they do and how fast they work.

questDatabase.name: Making things pretty
questDatabase.description: While conduits on their own are already awesome, you can also hide them if you want. There are 2 types of facades, basic and hardened. While basic ones are simple and easy, the reinforced ones are able to withstand explosions and mining with tools. You have to use your Yeta Wrench to remove it.

questDatabase.name: Come to the dark side...
questDatabase.description: ...we have cookies.

questDatabase.name: Luke, I'm your father
questDatabase.description: With that dark steel you got, you may now craft yourself a new set of armor. While pretty basic at beginning, it can be upgraded later to unlock powerful features.

questDatabase.name: Dark steel tools
questDatabase.description: There are also tools made of dark steel. Each of them can receive upgrades. Hold shift to get the tooltip which will explain what you need in order to upgrade them.

questDatabase.name: Basic upgrades
questDatabase.description: In order to upgrade your armor and tools, you need 10 Levels each, but also 8 Vibrant crystals.

questDatabase.name: Brewing liquids
questDatabase.description: This machine is not only capable of brewing more powerful burnable liquids, it can also be used to brew nutrient distillation, which might have a further usage soon(tm).

questDatabase.name: Smelting all-joy
questDatabase.description: This combination smelter allows you to produce fused quartz and quite clear glass of all variants.

questDatabase.name: Automated crafting
questDatabase.description: You know yet another automated crafting solution...

questDatabase.name: Ore processing kind of...
questDatabase.description: Maceration versus SAG milling, the war still rages on.

questDatabase.name: Torture device
questDatabase.description: When the subjects don't want to cooperate.

questDatabase.name: Not for rockets...
questDatabase.description: It claims to be rocket fuel, but it isn't. However, it does generate quite a bit of power. Use your "Vat" to make some. Will generate 160 RF/t when used in a combustion generator.

questDatabase.name: Tasty...
questDatabase.description: Yeah, that is... Well.. You are sure it will have an usage for something... some day... eventually...

questDatabase.name: Firewater
questDatabase.description: Not exactly what you think it is. Better to not consume that liquid. When used in the combustion generator, it will produce 80RF/t.

questDatabase.name: Hootch
questDatabase.description: The lowest tier of renewable, burnable fluid. Generates 60 RF/t, but can be automated for "green" infinite power.

questDatabase.name: Automated Mob-Farming
questDatabase.description: Of course... zombies loves that... disgusting liquid. While using a small amount per hit, he will attack everything that is within his range. That also includes players, so be careful. Rumors are, that there might be a weapon that will never break when used in this "machine"...

questDatabase.name: And it will never break
questDatabase.description: By using an etheric sword, your KillerJoe will run.. forever. Proper enchantments are a requirement for it to be efficient, but that shouldn't be a problem.

questDatabase.name: Simple item transfer
questDatabase.description: Translocators can only transfer items over a distance of 1 block. But they're quite cheap, and a good solution to build compact machine setups.

questDatabase.name: Simple fluid transfer
questDatabase.description: Just like the item translocators, the fluid ones transfer... fluids. Same restrictions apply, 1 block distance.

questDatabase.name: Harder, stronger, faster
questDatabase.description: No, actually not faster. But more durable than Tier1.

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Slightly better protection. Now with a real gun. No more food wasting.

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 turret base
questDatabase.description: Nothing to see here. Proceed...

questDatabase.name: Sometimes, a bullet will do
questDatabase.description: They hit hard. You have been warned.

questDatabase.name: Burn them. Burn them all!
questDatabase.description: Hmmm, crispy bacon. What would happen if you enable neutral mobs as targeting...?

questDatabase.name: Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Your first hull as usual...

questDatabase.name: Paying the highest price
questDatabase.description: When regular magic just isn't enough, you need something... stronger. Which is paid with blood. Your blood, and maybe others.

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Moon
questDatabase.description: HV is the age where you should focus on reaching the moon, as soon as possible. Since you will need titanium in large quantities.

questDatabase.name: I see everything
questDatabase.description: The inventory panel is an alternative to your (Hopefully?) existing ProjectRed storage system. Just like project red, you have to connect every chest/barrel with an item conduit. In addition to that, you also have to install a "remote awareness" upgrade into every conduit side you want the panel to see.

questDatabase.name: Portable battery...
questDatabase.description: Not exactly a "battery", more a portable access point for your life points, aka blood.

questDatabase.name: Soul eater
questDatabase.description: Wouldn't it be great to actually make use of the intelligence or abilities a certain creature has? For example: the ender-teleportation or brain capacity of a zombie for simple logic? (He doesn't use it anyway...) With this machine, you are able to bind a captured soul to an item, which can then be used in machines to improve their functionality.

questDatabase.name: A new alloy
questDatabase.description: There are some... "Darker" uses for machines. Stuff that might be considered "Magic". Anyway, for that you need a new alloy: Soularium

questDatabase.name: Experience-Storage
questDatabase.description: Dying is painful, isn't it? As your precious experience is lost. But fear not, there is a solution! By using an experience obelisk, you are now able to store all your experience in a safe location.

questDatabase.name: A soul vessel
questDatabase.description: For your new machine, you need something to actually capture souls from monsters. The soul vials are reusable vessels. Just right-click any living entity to steal its soul.

questDatabase.name: The creation of life
questDatabase.description: By utilizing large amounts of energy, you're able to re-activate those broken spawners you may have found in the past. If you haven't, you should get one now.

questDatabase.name: Specific enchantments
questDatabase.description: Enchanting books is, just as it is for items, random. And that is annoying if you need a specific enchantment on your tool or armor. Now there is a way to actually select enchantments, for a price, obviously.

questDatabase.name: Almost like steel
questDatabase.description: Next-gen protection against nasty Zombies, creepers and other "stuff".

questDatabase.name: Protect your base: Tier 3
questDatabase.description: Now we're talking: Grenades! Big booms.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 base
questDatabase.description: More storage, more power, and a lot more slots for possible upgrades.

questDatabase.name: This is relatively useful
questDatabase.description: For... some things... maybe... At least it is fun to watch.

questDatabase.name: Fire in the hole
questDatabase.description: Ah, there is nothing like an explosion and the certainty that your enemies have been blasted to pieces.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5
questDatabase.description: The main goal here is to get a Tier 2 rocket, and reach Mars. You also might want to rethink your power setup, as more and more machines will be upgraded. This quest set will teach you about a couple of options you have regarding power production.

questDatabase.name: *Poke*
questDatabase.description: Time to get some blood. You have to start with your own...

questDatabase.name: It's storage time!
questDatabase.description: Now that you've reached High Voltage age, you might consider starting to work on your AE System. It might be small, and it might be tricky to power it at first, but it's really worth the effort. You should start by getting all 4 inscriber patterns.

questDatabase.name: Find them all
questDatabase.description: There are a lot of asteroids on the surface, but there are more underground. In order to find those, you need a compass. (This quest is optional)

questDatabase.name: Drives
questDatabase.description: Quite different from anything you've seen before. Make sure to check out the Item/Fluid processors!

questDatabase.name: Fluix crystals
questDatabase.description: Not "flux"! Even if the color is the same.

questDatabase.name: Applied Crafting
questDatabase.description: Crafting can be a pain. So why not automate it?

questDatabase.name: Getting your first circuits
questDatabase.description: Making the circuits is quite different from what you're used to, so it's advised to check NEI for the new recipes. Get 8 of each circuits for now.

questDatabase.name: Cables
questDatabase.description: To have access to your AE from your entire base, you'll need cables. A lot of them. For now, the basic ones will do, but eventually, you'll end up using dense cables and P2P Channels.

questDatabase.name: Terminals everywhere
questDatabase.description: And a pain to craft, no doubt...

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Mars
questDatabase.description: Mars have many new Ores you need to find like Tungsten, Uranium and Plutonium.

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Phobos
questDatabase.description: A smaller goal, as the main goal is Mars. But you'll find different ores on this planet too.

questDatabase.name: Dimensional Goal: Deimos
questDatabase.description: A smaller goal, as the main goal is Mars. But you'll find different ores on this planet also.

questDatabase.name: HEV Mark III Protective System
questDatabase.description: Some things are dirty, and some things are even dangerous. You'll play with nasty stuff here, so better prepare yourself.

questDatabase.name: Appropriate power
questDatabase.description: Whether you used Magic, Steam, Oil or Biogas for power until now, you'll run into problems as you advance to higher tiers. So you need to upgrade your power grid, at least for your blast furnaces. So let's start with something more powerful: A nuclear reactor!

questDatabase.name: Tier 2 fuel: Uranium
questDatabase.description: Just "regular" uranium fuel, nothing special about it.

questDatabase.name: Tier 3 fuel: MOX
questDatabase.description: Highly radioactive, the most powerful fuel rod you can get. Burns twice as fast as uranium, but produces massive amounts of power. Rumors are, that peaks up to 11kEU/t are possible...

questDatabase.name: Tier 1 fuel: Thorium
questDatabase.description: The weakest of all rods, but very easy to produce, very easy to keep cool and runs twice as long as uranium. A perfect "fire and forget" power source.

questDatabase.name: Monitoring your reactor
questDatabase.description: It's important to monitor your reactor (Or just fancy to have a big screen somewhere...). So now that you've gained knowledge about the available fuel rods, you can start to build yourself a power plant. Here is something to help you out.

questDatabase.name: Increasing the capacity
questDatabase.description: To unleash the full potential of your reactor, you have to attach 6 reactor chambers to it.

questDatabase.name: Move the heat
questDatabase.description: Reactors heat up, well the rods do, so you need to "move the heat away" to somewhere else. You should get one of each, and try to figure out what each individual heat exchangers do, in order to figure out a good setup.

questDatabase.name: Venting heat
questDatabase.description: You can't just move the heat around; Eventually you need to get rid of it. Just like the exchangers, there are different types of vents, each of them has a certain usage you'll need to find out.

questDatabase.name: Double the fun
questDatabase.description: Need even more power? Why not combine rods? Produces twice the amount of power (and heat, obviously) but only uses up one slot.

questDatabase.name: Quit exhaling dusts
questDatabase.description: The QED is used for stuff like EnderQuarry (Yay!) and advanced mob-protection.

questDatabase.name: Advanced mob-protection
questDatabase.description: Like the chandelier, the magnum torch prevents monsters from spawning. However, its range is quite big, so a single one might be enough for your entire base.

questDatabase.name: Automated mining
questDatabase.description: The QED enables you to assemble the most convenient device for mining: The EnderQuarry.

questDatabase.name: Accelerating things
questDatabase.description: If an ender quarry won't satisfy your needs for MOOORE. Speed upgrade is required.

questDatabase.name: Bundled AE channels
questDatabase.description: P2P tunnels. You need them and a lot of them!

questDatabase.name: Load and Unload the rocket
questDatabase.description: What use has an automated rocket, if you can't load and unload it with automation?

questDatabase.name: Cargo rocket: For the fun
questDatabase.description: No need to fly to distant planets on your own, just to grab ores.

questDatabase.name: Turning A into B with C
questDatabase.description: Molecular transforming all the things! The most important recipe here is sunnarium.

questDatabase.name: Turret base Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Even more range, power and upgrade slots.

questDatabase.name: Protect your base: Tier 4
questDatabase.description: Parts for powerful turrets.

questDatabase.name: Make love, not war
questDatabase.description: For those who don't want to kill things. Just teleport them away however takes a large amount of power.

questDatabase.name: Why grenades...
questDatabase.description: ...when you can use rockets? Yes, Rockets! They search and destroy, and go off with a huge boom.

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 fence and walls
questDatabase.description: Another upgrade for you walls. One more to go!

questDatabase.name: Pulverize the moon
questDatabase.description: Literally. You can grind the rock of most planets, to get a chance for higher tier metal dusts. Does consume quite a bit of power, but can really help you out.

questDatabase.name: Tier 6
questDatabase.description: IV-Level. You will need Tungstensteel for machines. Supposed Planets to visit: Mars, Phobos, Deimos. You should've learned "How to Gregtech" by now, if not go clean up the machine craters...

questDatabase.name: This is the end.... ?
questDatabase.description: Basically the "end" of the conventional tiered game play. However! This is just the start of your journey, as you'll have access to even more powerful and awesome stuff. You have proven yourself worthy, and mastered the challenges up to this Tier. Congratulations!

questDatabase.name: On your way to Tier 7
questDatabase.description: The next Tier is defined as "Asteroids-Dimension" and "8192 EU/t Machines". The machines now reached their full potential, and some asteroids may contain precious ores to improve your power generation.

questDatabase.name: "Clean" energy..?
questDatabase.description: Finally, a reliable and powerful source of energy for your base. And why waste your time with a 2k generator? Go for a 8k one! (Hint: It's probably a good idea to wear your hazmat suite before claiming your reward...)

questDatabase.name: Final choice: Void
questDatabase.description: Tired of mobs in your base? Want to build somewhere.. Different? Probably in a void Dimension? Then this is your chance. But choose wisely; You can only pick one option.

questDatabase.name: Final choice: Loot
questDatabase.description: Don't need a void dim, eh? Well, then you'll probably be happy about some extra loot. Choose wisely; You can only pick one.

questDatabase.name: Almost unbreakable
questDatabase.description: Probably not required any more, but you made so many walls. So why not to get the best ones?

questDatabase.name: Protect your base: Tier 5
questDatabase.description: Tough materials, for tough weapons. Railguns, and lasers, and... stuff. I assume you want a lot of those soon.

questDatabase.name: Turret base Tier 5
questDatabase.description: The last one, I promise. Used for the most powerful turrets available. You wonder if they might help you take out some more... "Dangerous" enemies?

questDatabase.name: PewPew!
questDatabase.description: Requires no ammo, but still does a ton of damage. All you need to do is feed it power.

questDatabase.name: Railguns, what else
questDatabase.description: Massive power, and a wonderful sound when they fire. I recommend to use upgrades to increase range and damage.

questDatabase.name: Strange things
questDatabase.description: You came across those weird trees, they seem to be more than just plants. You felt something... different. There is something going on, but you are not sure what exactly yet. But you're sure you'll find out very soon(tm).

questDatabase.name: Searching for answers
questDatabase.description: Last night, you had a dream. A Dimension, so weird and different, exactly like the sapling you found. You decided to go there and look for answers.

questDatabase.name: See the unseen
questDatabase.description: Everything is made of 6 primal aspects. Those aspects can be combined to form compound aspects, but in the end, there are only 6. Like the infused shards you found. You noticed that those shards start to vibrate when you bring them next to something that is made of the respective aspect. Maybe you can create a device to actually "scan" items, and reveal their compounds? This could be very useful later on.

questDatabase.name: Tables to work on
questDatabase.description: Indeed, the idea with the bookshelf did work. Now you need a nice table to do some research on, and probably something to infuse items with vis while crafting. Maybe you should try to smite a table with your wand.

questDatabase.name: Bloody Water
questDatabase.description: By sacrificing some blood to the water spirits, they'll grant you some of their precious element.

questDatabase.name: Infused stones
questDatabase.description: This whole place here is filled with magic. No matter where you look at, it's just everywhere. You wonder what happens to regular stone if it's exposed to large amounts of magic for such a long time. Maybe it's time to go mining?

questDatabase.name: Your first wand
questDatabase.description: You are sure that this place will give you all the answers you are looking for! To continue, you need something to handle the magic energy called "Vis". Guess it's time to craft your first wand.

questDatabase.name: Tome of knowledge
questDatabase.description: All the things you've discovered so far, you need to write them down. But you are lazy, and you have a wand, so why not try a magical way to "write down" your research? You wonder if you could enchant a book with your wand, so that it will keep track of your progress... You should try that on a bookshelf!

questDatabase.name: Improving your wand
questDatabase.description: Your wand does a great job in storing and releasing vis as you please. However, those iron caps are... Weak. If you don't pay enough attention to it, it might hurt the node. Maybe you should try to improve it with caps made out of a more valuable material. Like.. Gold, maybe?

questDatabase.name: Getting shards
questDatabase.description: Now that you found all 6 primal types of infused stone, you need to break those up in order to get the shards. The easiest way to do that, is to throw these stones in your forge hammer.

questDatabase.name: A "greater" Wand
questDatabase.description: While doing all your research and mining of these infused stones, you had an idea how to actually use the Wood of a Greatwood tree to make a new wand. Actually, it turned out to be pretty simple, but you lacked one important thing back then: Vis!. The vis makes sure the wood doesn't loose it's magic conductivity while forming the rod.

questDatabase.name: Better screws
questDatabase.description: Unfortunately, your aluminium screws don't work with the greatwood rod. Somehow, the wood seems to repel the material. Luckily, you already have a blast furnace, so you can get a better material than aluminium.

questDatabase.name: A more powerful "scale"
questDatabase.description: The Naga scales are weak, they can only hold a very limited amount of Vis. You need a better, more powerful component to store Vis in your wand. You've heard rumors about an evil Wizard in the Twilight forest. Maybe he has... something... that can be used?

questDatabase.name: "Stores 50 Vis" Wand
questDatabase.description: Now combine your new wand, and be more powerful than before! You have a feeling, that this new wand will become handy very soon(tm)

questDatabase.name: Fuuuuuu...(sion)!
questDatabase.description: Your arcane table does a great job with infusing primal vis into items while crafting. However, you feel that there must be more. What if you could infuse items with all kinds of magic aspects? The possibilities are endless...

questDatabase.name: Yet another brick in the wall...
questDatabase.description: A magic one this time. You are on your way to infusion, and you need 8 of those in total.

questDatabase.name: Essentia cooking
questDatabase.description: In order to get essentia, you need to dissolve items. Obviously, you only want to dissolve those items you don't really need, and only those which essentia you need to craft things.

questDatabase.name: Not for soup
questDatabase.description: At least not for edible soup, but for essentia slurry. Get yourself a Cauldron and give it a whack with your wand.

questDatabase.name: Balanced shards sdrahs decnalaB
questDatabase.description: By combining all 6 primal aspects in a crucible, you are able to make balanced shards. They can be ground up into Salis Mundus, an absolutely crucial thing to have, trust me!

questDatabase.name: Crystal clusters
questDatabase.description: You, as a Thaumaturge, like shiny things. And what could be more shiny than a cluster made of those shards? You totally should get one of each.

questDatabase.name: The choice: Ignis
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore:9: Second hand. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: The choice...
questDatabase.description: By now, you should've collected a few (or a lot) of locations for Aura nodes to get Vis from. You  might also have noticed, that you probably are low on a certain aspect, like Ordo or Ignis. Well, good news. In exchange for some crystal clusters, I will give you one of my old nodes. They are all pale, but they will help you out. You may only choose one, so think twice before you make your decision.

questDatabase.name: The choice: Terra
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore:9: Second hand. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: The choice: Perditio
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore:9: Second hand. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: The choice: Ordo
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore:9: Second hand. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: The choice: Aqua
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore:9: Second hand. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: The choice: Aer
questDatabase.description: In exchange for 2 clusters, I will give you this node. May it serve you well. Oh, don't place it too close to another node, or it might start to drain Vis...

Lore:9: Second hand. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: Not just for decoration
questDatabase.description: Sure, they look pretty, but they serve a much more important purpose: Channeling vast amounts of Vis and essentia. This might be usefull soon(tm).

questDatabase.name: This is the end...
questDatabase.description: ...of your apprenticeship. You have mastered all 6 primal aspects, you mastered the weak and strong infusion of essentia and vis, and you've already made your adept wand. But be warned, young one. The further you progress, the more darkness, and evil will tempt you to follow the forbidden ways of magic. I have seen things... weather changing, random teleportation, or even a Wither spawning right next to someone. Be careful, my friend...

questDatabase.name: Turning liquids into essentia
questDatabase.description: What a simple idea. So many people wasted tons of buckets just to get Aqua from Water, or Sano from Milk. Why didn't they just dissolve the liquid itself? Stupid ones...

questDatabase.name: Essentia filtering
questDatabase.description: This nifty little device will filter out essentia. Once it has received a single unit of any type, it will only accept this type until it is completely empty. How convenient. You can place more than one on top of an alchemical furnace.

questDatabase.name: An alternative to torches
questDatabase.description: And lava! It's an excellent heat source.

questDatabase.name: Not coal
questDatabase.description: Way better. To be fair, it's a waste to use coal itself, but it also works with charcoal and lignite dust. And it speeds up the dissolving of items in an alchemical furnace.

questDatabase.name: Save the squids, we must
questDatabase.description: A very convenient way to make PETA activists happy and get ink at the same time. (Hint: The essentia in those roses might be useful...)

questDatabase.name: Infinite... Lava?
questDatabase.description: Well, it does need some Ignis Centi-vis, but hey, it's free.

questDatabase.name: Infinite water!
questDatabase.description: The struggle is over. You finally discovered a way to get infinite amounts of water.

questDatabase.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questDatabase.description: I have mastered the basics. Master warned me about forbidden magic, but it sounds so promising. I think a bit of forbidden stuff can't hurt...

questDatabase.name: An awesome magic conductor
questDatabase.description: These tears, WOW! I've never felt something so strong. Could it be? Could I use those to actually finalize my Silverwood wand?

questDatabase.name: An even better conductor?
questDatabase.description: More... I want MOOORE! There must be something even stronger than the Hydra. Something older, more ancient.

questDatabase.name: It doesn't work
questDatabase.description: I tried to combine the lich bones I had with this new wand rod. The result: A pile of ashes. It crumbled to dust within seconds. I need a better conductor. The hydra in the twilight forest has the ability to regrow an entire head! Her blood must contain a large amount of magic. I guess I need a bit of that for my next wand.

Lore:9: It crumbled to dust within seconds...

questDatabase.name: Obsidian Rod
questDatabase.description: By using Obsidian and some Earth clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Terra vis.

questDatabase.name: Creating a better wand
questDatabase.description: This greatwood wand is nice, but it can only store 50 Vis. Not enough to move nodes. My tries to use Silverwood failed, but I've come across other mundane materials that I could use to make a new wand core.

questDatabase.name: More durable screws
questDatabase.description: Those stainless steel screws don't work on these rods. Due to the huge amounts of Vis those wands can carry, the screws somehow "melt" away. I need a more durable material. I guess I will try titanium.

Lore:9: It.. melted..?!

questDatabase.name: Quartz rod
questDatabase.description: By using nether quartz and some Order clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Ordo vis.

questDatabase.name: Reed rod
questDatabase.description: By using sugar cane and some Air clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Aer vis.

questDatabase.name: Blazing rod
questDatabase.description: By using a blaze rod and some Fire clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Ignis vis.

questDatabase.name: Icy rod
questDatabase.description: By using hardened ice and some Water clusters, I'm able to create a magical infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Aqua vis.

questDatabase.name: Bone rod
questDatabase.description: Forbidden? Pah. I don't care about headaches. By using Bone and Entropy clusters, I'm able to create an infused rod, that will slowly recharge its own Perditio vis.

questDatabase.name: Best wand caps ever
questDatabase.description: Of course! Thaumium! What could conduct Vis better than... a magical metal?

questDatabase.name: She let go
questDatabase.description: This blood seems pretty common, but she had advanced magic abilities. I'm sure I can use this as a medium.

questDatabase.name: Reactor material
questDatabase.description: This stuff is interesting... Maybe I can use it as wand conductor?

questDatabase.name: Centi-Vis
questDatabase.description: Many advanced machines require Vis in order to do what they're supposed to. But using a wand as some sort of battery to transfer Vis from a Node to your machine didn't work as expected. What if you could rip open a node?

questDatabase.name: Bring it home
questDatabase.description: You probably have a nice collection of bookmarked nodes. But running around to recharge your wand(s) isn't really the way an adept thaumaturge should get his required vis. Moving nodes is not that hard, but without doubt, you need something to protect them from each other.

questDatabase.name: Automated wand-recharge
questDatabase.description: So you found a way to gather nodes now. What about automated wand recharge? Wouldn't that be extremely convenient?

questDatabase.name: Centi-Vis stuff
questDatabase.description: You totally should get yourself some Centi-Vis things to transport and use the Vis from stabilized nodes.

questDatabase.name: The dark realm
questDatabase.description: We found the way... my precious. We found it! Only need 4 tasty eyes, and some magic to open the door. The secret door, they didn't see it. Hehehe! All the time. It was there... Aaaall the time!

questDatabase.name: They see me, they watch me
questDatabase.description: Eyes. Yes. Eyes! I need eyes, my precious. Not spidery ones, no. Nasty hairy things. Don't taste good. Eldritch eyes! I will rip those from their bodies.

questDatabase.name: Really (Really!) dark magic
questDatabase.description: Fools. FOOLS I say! They know nothing! This book will guide me, yes. Yes it will, my precious. It will lead us to even more POWER!

questDatabase.name: Secrets
questDatabase.description: I can feel it. Yess. Yeeeess. We will gain more power nigh. Nigh! Yes. My precious. The voices gave me a hint, there is a dimension filled with unbelievable sources of magic energy. I must go there. I must! The Crimson people know the secret. I will rip them aparrrt.. They will tell me!

questDatabase.name: Find the key
questDatabase.description: No, nooo! They have hidden it! Must find the keeey. Must find it! We need the tablet to open the door my precious.

questDatabase.name: The power of creation
questDatabase.description: What... What am I doing here? Where am I?! What is this place?! Oh those headaches... (It seems that the pulsating pearl you just found cured your brain from... something. Something old, probably some kind of trap to keep away unworthy ones.)

questDatabase.name: Concentrated darkness
questDatabase.description: For some reason, you decided to infuse darkness into a seed. It appeared to be promising. For what? You don't know...

questDatabase.name: "Armor"
questDatabase.description: This new metal, it's so... appealing. You feel comfortable while holding it, so why not get yourself some armor? What could go wrong? It sure will protect you.

questDatabase.name: What could possibly go wrong?
questDatabase.description: 256 Essentia in one block! Now that is what I call storage. Does make weird sounds, but I guess it's nothing special...

questDatabase.name: Let's try this
questDatabase.description: Mortals. Pah. What do they know about REAL power. The voices tell me I need to focus on Alienis and Tenebrae if I want to advance. So what about food?

questDatabase.name: An appropriate weapon
questDatabase.description: My new armor needs an appropriate weapon to go along with. I should make something to fire creatures of the nether at enemies!

questDatabase.name: Improved Armor: Ninja Style
questDatabase.description: Time to get some decent armor. With this, those infernal monsters won't be as much of a pain as they are now.

questDatabase.name: Little helpers
questDatabase.description: A state of the art thaumaturge doesn't work any more. He has little helpers. Golems can and will do all the things for you, just as you command them.

questDatabase.name: Slightly better
questDatabase.description: Wood is somewhat better than straw. They are still to be considered weak, but an ideal little cutie for farms.

questDatabase.name: Sticks and stones...
questDatabase.description: ...will break your bones! These guys are hard as rock (Insert audience laugh here) and will protect your claim as good as possible.

questDatabase.name: The best of all
questDatabase.description: Highly durable, can carry a lot of items and is to be considered the "top tier" golem. But you are sure there is more...

questDatabase.name: Essentia storage
questDatabase.description: Sure, you could just go with gazillions of jars, but it's way more convenient to store essentia in a chest or barrel. Isn't it?

questDatabase.name: The basic elements
questDatabase.description: Of course you know where and how to get the basic essentia types. Do you..?

questDatabase.name: Essentia transmission
questDatabase.description: What if... you could send essentia from a different location to your infusion matrix? You could finally get rid of all those jars around your altar. Also, there might be an additional use for those mirrors.

questDatabase.name: (Almost) Automated essentia
questDatabase.description: By combining the essentia locus, the essentia mirror and an essentia aggregator, you are now able to transmit essentia from almost anywhere. Fancy essentia-storage facility incomming!

questDatabase.name: Essentia Monitoring
questDatabase.description: Manually checking your jars can be tedious, especially if you want to infuse a bunch of stuff at once. Luckily, the Essentia Locus can help you with that, as it monitors all jars that have been targeted with a crystalline eye.

questDatabase.name: Cleaning the goo
questDatabase.description: As you're doing more and more infusions, you're probably tired of removing all the flux that's generated from time to time. The shovel of the purifier will help you with that task, and is a must-have.

questDatabase.name: One does not simply...
questDatabase.description:
...play with magic. Be warned, those fires are dangerous to use. But who doesn't want a patch of snow in the nether?

cFire spread is disabled via config on Servers because of massive lag and world destruction.

questDatabase.name: Useful plant life
questDatabase.description: While regular plants are basically just used to make food, you wondered if you could get some... "more special" plant life going...

questDatabase.name: Pushing the limits
questDatabase.description: Regular enchantments do have a limit, like III for Fortune. By utilizing magic, you should be able to bypass that limitation, at least a tiny bit; Eventually creating enchantments like Fortune IV. It comes with limitations, but your book shall tell you more about those.

questDatabase.name: Enchanting like a pro
questDatabase.description: Finally, a device where you can actually choose which enchantment you want to have. Powered by vis, it can create the most powerful combinations one could imagine.

questDatabase.name: Crying obsidian...
questDatabase.description: ...it mourns about the dead ones. This might come in handy for some cases. By placing 2 on top of each other, you're able to set your respawn point to that location, without the need for a bed. It's up to you to imagine the possibilities...

questDatabase.name: Useful trees
questDatabase.description: Just like plants, there are trees that will attract various friendly and "not so friendly" creatures. (No warranty when placed in desolated biome.)

questDatabase.name: The power of gods
questDatabase.description: The pearl you've found has some interesting effects on you. Not only the voices are almost gone, also somehow your perception has expanded. You can "feel" the magic around you. This is definitely worth some further investigation.

questDatabase.name: The final Goal
questDatabase.description: Thanks to your help, I managed to create the ultimate Energy Source: An encased wormhole that drains energy from a synthesized pocket universe up to the point when it reaches heat death. I have no use for it, so you may have it. Thank you for letting my dream come true!

questDatabase.name: Shards of opposite worlds
questDatabase.description: This morning, you just wanted to facepalm yourself to death. On your past journeys, you already saw strange colored shards. But unlike the primal shards you use every day, these seem to contain the raw essence of their dimension. The Hell and Heaven... so to say. Two opposite worlds.

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable cowl
questDatabase.description: It will never break. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable leggings
questDatabase.description: It will never break. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable robe
questDatabase.description: It will never break. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Infused cloth
questDatabase.description: By combining ichor with enchanted fabric, you've created something that could be compared to mithril. Light as wool, but durable like steel. Also, it conducts magic energy like nothing else you've seen before. This seems to be an excellent material for a new armor.

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your armor to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable boots
questDatabase.description: It will never break. How convenient.

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable axe
questDatabase.description: A axe made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Infused Thaumium
questDatabase.description: By combining ichor with some thaumium, the metal turned into something new; Something extremely durable but also soft. Its magic conductivity is incredible

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable Sword
questDatabase.description: A sword made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable
questDatabase.description: A pickaxe made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Unbreakable shovel
questDatabase.description: A shovel made of your new metal will never break, and will accept enchantments with ease. Something tells you there must be more...

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Unleashed the power
questDatabase.description: To make use of your tool to its full extend, you'll have to unleash its hidden power. This is not an easy task; But its worth the effort!

questDatabase.name: Hold all the foci
questDatabase.description: Hermione's first years bag.

questDatabase.name: Where do the items go?
questDatabase.description: It's better to not ask...

questDatabase.name: Magical waystones
questDatabase.description: These are used to mark target locations in order to teleport around

questDatabase.name: Why walk...
questDatabase.description: ...when you can teleport? This little device allows you to teleport around almost for free. Is it cheaty? Is it OP? Nope, it's a celestial gateway!

questDatabase.name: Brewers start
questDatabase.description: In order to get started with your basic witchery needs, you need a witches oven. It's used to get the most basic ingredients for your recipes: The Fumes.

questDatabase.name: Offerings
questDatabase.description: For all your offering needs. And, of course, it looks fancy!

questDatabase.name: A cauldron?
questDatabase.description: The second thing you'll need is a cauldron. It is used to craft most of the basic items, like mutandis.

questDatabase.name: Don't touch the needle!
questDatabase.description: While having not many recipes by itself, the few it has are rather important for your further witchery progression.

questDatabase.name: Probably usable for soup
questDatabase.description: But its main purpose is to brew potions and infusions.

questDatabase.name: Don't shake it too much
questDatabase.description: Unlike nitroglycerin, this stuff doesn't explode. But you still shouldn't shake it too much...

questDatabase.name: Getting basic fumes
questDatabase.description: Fume extraction is an essential thing to do, and you'll need a lot of those on your journey.

questDatabase.name: Circle magic
questDatabase.description: For circle magic, you need... a circle, obviously. There are 4 types of chalk you can use, and you'll need all of them to proceed.

questDatabase.name: Portable power source
questDatabase.description: By infusing a stone with fiery magic you may create an "Attuned Stone". These stones can be used to link non-magical devices to the magical currents present...

questDatabase.name: Flying OINKment
questDatabase.description: You tried, it doesn't fly. And it also doesn't make any OINK sounds, sadly. But there might be some use for it...

questDatabase.name: Nimbus 1999
questDatabase.description: Not as good as its successor, the 2000'ish model, but still "somehow" useful...

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Refined evil
questDatabase.description: Refined goodness is out of stock, sorry.

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Witches hand
questDatabase.description: In case you don't like the infernal witches...

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Seeping shoes
questDatabase.description: Who needs an antidote?

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Taglock kits
questDatabase.description: Get a death protection poppet and get a stack of taglock kits. For all your trolling needs.

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: Drop of luck
questDatabase.description: Hard to get, even with that quest. But less of a grind...

questDatabase.name: Bloodlust: "Cain" sword
questDatabase.description: Serves 2 purposes: Style. And... ah, yeah... Something useful for vampires.

questDatabase.name: Be a vampire; Like a sir
questDatabase.description: Sometimes it can be troublesome to get fancy clothing. However, if you prove yourself worthy, you get a set for free.

questDatabase.name: A few more things...
questDatabase.description:
Ok, I think I have everything I need to assemble the device. Can you assist me with some additional Materials? I need to update most of my machines, as these exotic components you got me already damaged most of them already. Don't worry, I have a list here.

Most of my circuits burned to crisp while I was trying to measure the conductivity of these soul and life shards. I need better ones.
