You live close to the Water and don't have a Boat?
You need Wooden Planks, Slabs and a Knife to craft one. (This is also quest id 666, be sure that something is going on)

questDatabase.name: Trainspotting
questDatabase.description: The Wooden Tracks can be made without any machine. Functionally equivalent to normal rails, but with a lower maximum speed (for safety reasons).

questDatabase.name: Rubber Boat
questDatabase.description: The Rubber Dinghy requires only a few Rubber Plates. Like the vanilla wooden boat, it will break and dismantle whenever it hits a surface, however instead of returning sticks and planks, it will return a Damaged Rubber Dinghy, which can be re-crafted with two pieces of Rubber back into a useable Rubber Dinghy!

questDatabase.name: Inflatable Boot
questDatabase.description: I meant to say boat... The Inflatable Boat is the first Boot that don't break on impact.

questDatabase.name: Carbon Fiber Boat
questDatabase.description:
Unlike all other boats, this amazing Carbon Fiber Canoe is COMPLETELY INDESTRUCTIBLE!* This means that you can smash it into as many beaches, lily pads and alligators as you like, the Carbon Fiber Canoe won't take a scratch!

Warning: We are not held responsible for any damage caused by riding the Carbon Fiber Canoe into a Lava Lake or the Void.

*Therefore, warrinty NOT included.

questDatabase.name: Electric Boat
questDatabase.description: The Electric Boat works mostly like a vanilla boat, chugging through the water at a decent pace. It will hopefully drop itself once you crash, which is slightly nicer than the usual sticks. That's all well and good, but what if we utilize the electric engine? Wearing an energy storage device in your chestplate slot, like a Batpack or Energypack, will cause the boat to drain energy from it and propel you forward at supersonic speed! Doing this will consume about 100 EU per block traveled, so even a decent Batpack will not last long!

questDatabase.name: Boat Shape?
questDatabase.description: Really? Yes for the more advanced Boats you need a new Shape Form.

questDatabase.name: LV Extruder
questDatabase.description: The Extruder not much useful in LV Age. But it extrude your next Tier of Boat.

questDatabase.name: Wooden Rail variants
questDatabase.description: The Wooden Junction, Wye and Switch Track need an Assembler to craft. Wthey allow to join and switch tracks going to different Locations.

questDatabase.name: Switch Lever
questDatabase.description:
The Switch Lever is the manual version of the Switch Motor, requiring a player to operate it instead of a redstone signal. 
It is used in various signaling systems, mainly to change the way Switch Tracks and Wye Tracks work.

questDatabase.name: Crowbar
questDatabase.description:
The Crowbar comes in a Railcraft and a Gregtech variant. It is used to manipulate machines from Railcraft, remove Plates and any other covers (Pumps, Conveyor belts, etc.) from Gregtech Pipes and Machines as well as breaking certain objects faster, such as Tracks. This tool is also used to access certain inventories from Railcraft.

The Crowbar can be used as a weapon, though it costs twice as much durability on attack (Just like any other non weapon tool...).

questDatabase.name: Minecart
questDatabase.description:
After you craft your first Cart the Journey can begin...
Well, not really you need some Tracks first.

questDatabase.name: Fast Food > Slow Food
questDatabase.description: Three Fast Food Lootbags give a better one = Slow Food Lootbag. (Since when Slow Food is better?)

questDatabase.name: Slow Food > Haute Cuisine
questDatabase.description: Three Slow Food Lootbags give a better one = Haute Cuisine Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Haute Cuisine > Dessert
questDatabase.description: Six Haute Cuisine Lootbags give a better one = Dessert Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Transportation Class 3 > Transportation Class 2
questDatabase.description: Three Transportation Class 3 Lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 2 Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Transportation Class 2 > Transportation Class 1
questDatabase.description: Three Transportation Class 2 Lootbags give a better one = Transportation Class 1 Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: Wet dirt armor?
questDatabase.description: If you don't have any armor "Mud Armor" is better nothing. Mud can be found in some wet Biomes.

questDatabase.name: Wooden Armor
questDatabase.description: If you can't find Mud you can make a very poor Armor out of Wood. Cutting down like three trees to make a set should do. You will need Soft Mallet too.

questDatabase.name: Armor 2.0
questDatabase.description: Iron Armor is much better than the Leather Armor. Especially when you go outside at night.

questDatabase.name: Leather Armor
questDatabase.description:
Killing some Cows will give you enough Leather to craft a complete Set of Leather Armor. 
Hint: You can dye this Armor.

questDatabase.name: Bronze Armor
questDatabase.description: Bronze Armor have the same Abilities as Iron Armor. Same durability, Same protection and enchantment capability.

questDatabase.name: "Nice to have" Armor
questDatabase.description: The Gold Armor is a "nice to heave" Armor. The durability is very low but you look expensive when you wear it.

questDatabase.name: "Oh Shiny" Armor
questDatabase.description: Diamond Armor is the best Armor in Vanilla Minecraft, but not anymore there are much better Armors available.

questDatabase.name: Fancy Armor
questDatabase.description: Not really better but fancy. The Chain Mail Armor is made out of Steel rings.

questDatabase.name: Armor 2.5
questDatabase.description: The Steel Armor have much more durability then the Iron/Bronze or Chainmail Armor.

questDatabase.name: Composite Vest
questDatabase.description: Combining the strength of Advanced Alloy Plates with the Steel Chestplate make your Vest very hard. Now you have double the durability and increased Armor Points by 1,5.

questDatabase.name: Fallen from the Sky
questDatabase.description:
There are Big Meteors everywhere and you are wondering why you need to mine them now?
Well Skystone is a good source for rare Earth metals in the LV Age. 
Inside the Meteor you can find a Skystone Chest containing some Processor Press Plates. Save them for later they will be really important.

questDatabase.name: One Anvil... better Two!
questDatabase.description:
With your brand-new Compressor you are able to make some Metal Blocks for your new Anvil. Better craft two anvils, one will be required for the forge hammer.

With the Anvil you can repair, rename and enchant Armor and Tools.

questDatabase.name: Automation Tier 1
questDatabase.description:
Do you want to automate your Smeltery because you are planning to make stacks of Glass Blocks? 
No problem, craft a large Bronze Pipe and place it under the Faucet. Now the molten Fluid will flow inside the pipe. Under the pipe you have to place the Casting Basins or Tables.
A Hopper and a Chest underneath would be good to auto-output products.

questDatabase.name: Automation Tier 2
questDatabase.description: You want a better Automation than using Pipes? Sure, craft a Comparator and link it with redstone dust placed on the Ground. The Redstone needs to be adjent to the faucet to activate the crafting process.

questDatabase.name: 2x Steel
questDatabase.description: Steel production is so slow. If you got enough Copper build a second BBF. They can share the Walls.

questDatabase.name: 4x Steel
questDatabase.description: Not even two BBFs are fast enough...

questDatabase.name: Why one coke oven when you can have ten
questDatabase.description: Your Bronze Blast Furnace uses coal like hell and your Steam Boiler too? Well it's time to make more Coke Ovens and automate them a bit. Wooden Fluid Pipes and Tin Item Pipes will help you reach your Goal.

questDatabase.name: How dark can you go?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, how dark can one be? You are sure the face in that crystal was nothing but imagination...

questDatabase.name: Ascended
questDatabase.description: You feel empowered, light, almost like a ghost.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 slates
questDatabase.description: 1023 Buckets of blood in one slate! How much more I can store, oh I wish I would know. Then I add one and check if it works. 1024 Buckets of blood in one slate! ... ...

questDatabase.name: Powerful shards
questDatabase.description: The demons summoned are rather strong, but their souls contain immense power!

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 slates
questDatabase.description: Tier 4 slates: Getting close.

questDatabase.name: Accelerated plant growth
questDatabase.description: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why you don't counter that? A watering can will come in handy very soon.

questDatabase.name: Ethereal chalk
questDatabase.description: Top Tier chalk, for fancy wall paintings?

questDatabase.name: Archmage orb. Let them come!
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 5 orb.

questDatabase.name: Master orb: Getting close
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 4 orb.

questDatabase.name: Elemental chalk II
questDatabase.description: Enhanced elemental chalk, to write "darker" runes than you're used to...

questDatabase.name: Tier 4 runes
questDatabase.description: You will want both runes. Rune of superior capacity to increase the storage of your blood altar, and rune of the orb. Later it is required if you want to advance to higher levels.

questDatabase.name: Tier 5 runes
questDatabase.description: The final frontier: There are not many runes available. The acceleration rune allows you to speed up the interaction with external tanks.

questDatabase.name: Advanced rituals
questDatabase.description: More powerful rituals require dusk runes. With your new dusk chalk, you can enhance your ritual diviner to place those. Allowing you to perform a lot more rituals.

questDatabase.name: Highend rituals
questDatabase.description: The last rune so far, used for the most powerful rituals.

questDatabase.name: Convocation of the damned
questDatabase.description: Time to open a portal to the demons we're using all the time. What could possibly go wrong? (It is recommended to do this ritual on a planet, as the demon city will spread quite a bit...)

questDatabase.name: Imbued spell upgrades
questDatabase.description: With these new shards you are able to craft the most powerful spell components. Maybe it's time to upgrade your mining spell?

questDatabase.name: Find some Quartz
questDatabase.description: The Nether is full of different kinds of quartz. Go and find a quartzite and certus quartz vein. It is located between Y level 40-80.

questDatabase.name: Good Circuits.
questDatabase.description: Good circuits are better than basic ones. They are a component of all medium voltage GregTech machines.

questDatabase.name: Crop Breeding
questDatabase.description:
If you ever wanted to know how crop breeding works you are in the right place. Get some crops (the sticks) and some seeds from farming with a hoe or mattock.
Make a plot of farmland with your tool and place water in the middle. Make sure the area is well lit and quite big. 
Now place crop sticks in each corner of the field. Then place the seeds on the sticks and wait a bit.
When they are fully grown you can put double crop sticks in the remaining spots by using crop sticks on already placed crop sticks.
With some luck you might get a new unknown seed which can be scanned later.
Weeds need to be removed with a trowel otherwise your field will become overgrown by them.

questDatabase.name: First Breeding
questDatabase.description: New plants have grown on your crop sticks. You can harvest the crop by right clicking it or by left clicking with a seed bag eventually, This will destroy the plant though. Collect 8 seeds of any kind.

questDatabase.name: Weed II
questDatabase.description:
Weeds, weeds, and more weeds. You get so many of them while cross breeding. 
Need some  biogas cells for your power production in exchange? or maybe some glowstone to light up your fields.

questDatabase.name: Unknown seeds no more
questDatabase.description:
You have a lot of unknown seeds already. Use your scanner to scan all the seeds. 
Seeds can be planted again to breed better and more resillient crops.

questDatabase.name: Speed up your plant growth
questDatabase.description: To speed up the growth process a bit you can use a fertilizer. You will note, however, that bone meal no longer works. A bit of ash, apatite or calcite mixed with some distilled water in the chemical reactor will give you the fertilizer you need.

questDatabase.name: Potatos, Carrots, Pumkins and Melons
questDatabase.description:
Your seeds have three different values. growth, gain, and resistance (GGR).

The only way to change a crop's GGR without 3rd party tools is through cross breeding. When two plants cross-breed, the resulting plant will have a GGR score that is between both "parent" plants' GGR. Sometimes it will also be a little bit higher or lower. Thus, to obtain high GGR scores you must go through numerous generations of crossbreeding.

The highest score for GGR is 31.

questDatabase.name: Weed
questDatabase.description: Weed will show up from time to time on your crop sticks. Be careful and harvest the weed with your weed trowel before the whole field becomes overgrown with them and they destroy all your plants. Later you can make some weed Ex to destroy it.

questDatabase.name: Flower Power
questDatabase.description: Growing dyes on crops sticks? Try to plant some flowers. If you cross breed Rose and Dandelion flowers you maybe get a new flower and new dyes with different colors.

questDatabase.name: Chemical rubber production
questDatabase.description: A much more efficient way to make insulated cables is by making molten rubber in the chemical reactor which can be applied to a cable in the Assembler. When you put both machines next to each other you can output the molten rubber directly to the assembler.

questDatabase.name: Better than barrels
questDatabase.description: While barrels offer only a single slot for storage, drawers can go up to 4 slots each, 16 stacks in each slot. they can also be used to make a "ghetto ME storage system 9121459fkfedoromlkfed8751(Tec2k17)"0 later in the HV age with some help from ?cProjectRed Transportation.?6

questDatabase.name: Compact Drawers
questDatabase.description: They are very compact and add some fanciness to your glorious dirt base.

questDatabase.name: Framing Drawers
questDatabase.description: Now you can really make some swaggy and even FANCIER drawers using this table, all you have to do is place some decorative blocks (works with almost ALL decorative blocks) and it will take their texture, the TOP left is the outer Square bottom left is for the front face and top right is for the borders.

questDatabase.name: Biogas Source
questDatabase.description:
You are using steam, creosote, and possibly oil plus their by-products to generate Power. It's time to start with biogas. You can use wheat, sugarcane, apples or saplings.

Be sure you have a managed Forestry farm, Steve's Cart Farm or Ic2 Crop Sticks with a harvester because you need plenty of biomaterials for constant biogas production.

Hint: Hazelnut is the ultimative source for biogas.

questDatabase.name: Plant balls
questDatabase.description: The first step is to compress plant balls out of your wheat. Your LV Compressor is to slow for it. I suggest to craft 4 MV Compressors for the new biogas processing Line.

questDatabase.name: Plant Mass
questDatabase.description: Macerate the plantballs down to plant mass for better processing. In the LV and MV tiers you get only one plant mass per, in HV tier you recieve two. IV Macerator gives up to four of them with a chance of 50% and 25%.

questDatabase.name: Bio Chaff
questDatabase.description: Plant mass needs to be centrifuged into bio chaff, the base material to make biomass. You need 1-2 MV Centrifuges to run the new production line.

questDatabase.name: Way One: IC 2 Fluid Canner
questDatabase.description: The first way you get biomass out of bio chaff is to use the IC2 Fluid Canner. One bucket of water and one bio chaff give one bucket of biomass. In HV Tier you can use the Pyrolyze Oven to do it in a more efficient way.

questDatabase.name: Way Two: Brewery
questDatabase.description: If you are lucky and find some brewing stands or familiar enough with Thaumcraft to make one you can craft a Brewery. You get 750mb of biomass out of 750mb water and 1 bio chaff. In HV tier you can use the Pyrolyze Oven to do it in a more efficient way.

questDatabase.name: Biogas
questDatabase.description:
With the MV Distillery you can distill biogas out of the biomass. If you reach HV Tier there's a more efficient way to process it, the Distillation Tower Multi Block.
Biogas has a burn value of 40,000 EU per cell in the Gas Turbine.

questDatabase.name: Can u eat those?
questDatabase.description:
No you can't eat them but you can add them to your routed pipes. Without chips routed pipes can't do anything on their own, chips also have a GUI to configure them wich can be opened by right clicking. 
There are 8 types of chips:

-Item extractor chip can be used to send items from its inventory to responder, dynamic responder, terminator and overflow responder chips in a pipe network. 

-Item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network wich match the filter configured to the inventory connected to the responder chip. Chips with higher priority value will receive items first until the inventory is full then will be sent to other inventories with valid filters and remaining space.

-Dynamic item responder chip will request items from the extractor chips in your network that match items inside the dynamic item responder connected inventory. This chip has to be in the same interface pipe as the item responder chip in order to work. Priority rules apply here as well. 

-Item overflow responder works exactly the same as the item responder chip, however it only accepts items that cannot go to an item responder chip, dynamic item responder chip, or item terminator chip. 

-Item terminator chip works as a backup for responder chips.

-Item broadcaster chip will show you the inventory connected to the routed request pipe on the pipe network and can be used to retrieve items from it. They can also extract for wich side you configure them. 

-Item stock keeper chip will constantly check the network for items and pull them to its pipe. If the chip is set to pull when empty, it will only pull if the inventory next to it is empty, otherwise it will pull when there are less items in the inventory than configured in the chip.

-Item crafting chips craft things. 

-Item crafting extension chips are placed inside the item crafting chips. Make sure you randomize the id.

questDatabase.name: Routed Pipes
questDatabase.description:
There are six types of routed pipes: 

-Junction pipe is used to form an intersection that will allow other routed pipes to communicate. 

-Interface pipe will connect to an inventory allowing you to extract or insert items, chips can be used to control the logic. 

-Request pipe will allow requesting only specific items to be send through pipes.

-Firewall pipe can control wich items can pass through them.

questDatabase.name: Ghetto Me System
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are familiar with the mod it's time to organize items in your base a bit. These are the things you need in order to get a basic extract/insert system.

First of all you will need a drawer controller. You can pick it from here or craft it yourself and place it down. Next to it add as much drawers as you want, and make sure they are touching each other or the controller.

The next step is to connect a routed interface pipe to your drawer controller. Take the item responder chip and configure it to filter mode: blacklist (this will allow you to get any items from your system) and add the chip to the routed interface pipe by right clicking on it. Don't forget the dynamic item responder.

In order to allow your system to be able to see items you need to add the item broadcast chip TO THE SAME ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE WICH IS CONNECTED TO THE DRAWER CONTROLLER.

The last step is to connect a routed request pipe IN THE SAME NETWORK AS THE ROUTED INTERFACE PIPE and right click it to acess the GUI. You can only extract items from it. In order to insert items simply right click them on the drawer controller. 

You can find more complex tutorials on youtube for autocrafting.

questDatabase.name: Extrude all the things
questDatabase.description:
Now you hit the MV Tier and it's time to get a better ratio when making sticks, pipes, wires, plates and many more parts. Most recipes use more than 32 eu/t so better make a MV extruder. After crafting the machine you need some extruder shapes for the different types of parts you want to make.

Most of the Tinkers Gregworks tool parts are made in the extruder.

questDatabase.name: Tool Forge
questDatabase.description: Finally you get your first aluminum. Now it's time to craft a tool forge for making bigger Tinkers tools.

questDatabase.name: One Block mining is so Old School
questDatabase.description: By making a steel hammer you are now able to mine a shaft of 3x3 blocks. Be careful in the Nether or you could be boiled in lava very quickly.

questDatabase.name: Cutting a Tree log by log is so old School
questDatabase.description: By making a steel lumber axe you are now able to cut down the entire tree in one hit. Don't forget your backpack when you are cutting a sacred oak three down.

questDatabase.name: Mining Dirt Block by Block is so old School
questDatabase.description: By making a steel excavator you are now able to mine dirt in a 3x3 area. Don't destroy your whole garden.

questDatabase.name: Circuit Boards
questDatabase.description: To make circuit boards you need etched medium voltage wires and an empty circuit board. Press those together in the forming press.

questDatabase.name: Silicon
questDatabase.description: Due to the chip production silicon becomes a more important material. You can centrifuge it out of fullers earth, asbestos or redstone dust. The EBF is needed to make ingots. One ingot requires a Temperature of 1687 K for 84 seconds at 120 EU/t.

questDatabase.name: Etched Medium Voltage Wires
questDatabase.description: Etched medium voltage wire is one item for the new circuit board. It's made in the laser engraver.

questDatabase.name: Empty Circuit Board
questDatabase.description: Empty circuit boards require one silicon plate and one polyethylene sheet. Assemble those into an empty circuit board.

questDatabase.name: Are you Prepared for HV ?
questDatabase.description:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it by hand outputs 8 stainless steel Dust.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

questDatabase.name: Molten Platic
questDatabase.description: Molten polyethylene can be made in the chemical reactor using naptha and compressed air cells. Biomass is also a source for making Polyethylen. Use a mold for making plates in a fluid solidifier to make plastic sheets.

questDatabase.name: Mixing Stainless Steel
questDatabase.description:
Stainless steel will be the material for the HV Tier. There are two ways to process it. Mixing it in a mixer outputs 9 stainless steel dust each process.

Manganese can be found in ore veins together with grossular ore, spessartine ore, pyrolusite ore and tantalite ore.

Chrome can be centrifuged out of manganese dust and ruby dust.

questDatabase.name: Silicon Plate
questDatabase.description: Most of the circuit and solar panels recipes are using silicon plates.

questDatabase.name: Stainless Steel EBF processing
questDatabase.description:
Stainless steel ingots are made in the electric blast furnace at a temperature of 1700K  
80 seconds at 480 eu/t or using oxygen gas 60 seconds at 480 eu/t.

You need a miniumum of two MV energy hatches to power the EBF.

questDatabase.name: MV Energy Hatch
questDatabase.description: Some materials like stainless steel require 480 eu/t. Your LV Hatches are not good enough. Craft a minimum of two  Hatches to upgrade your EBF to HV.

questDatabase.name: Better than Duct Tape
questDatabase.description:
Better than duct tape is a soldering iron tool to remove the burned out circuits message. 
The soldering iron requires one soldering material item and 10,000 EU. Valid soldering materials are fine wires, rods, and ingots made from either tin, lead, or soldering alloy. The soldering iron will consume the first such material it finds in the player's inventory.

For the other problems other tools are necessary.

Possible problems                  Tool to fix
"Pipe is loose."                        Wrench
"Screws are missing."             Screwdriver 
"Something is stuck."               Soft mallet 
"Platings are dented."            Hammer 
"Circuitry burned out."          Soldering Iron 
"That doesn't belong there." Crowbar

questDatabase.name: Less Power loss
questDatabase.description: When you reach MV Tier you can make your own duct tape in case you have to move your EBF around. Duct tape will fix all maintenance problems in the EBF.

questDatabase.name: Ruby Electrolyzing
questDatabase.description: Ruby is a good source for electrolysing to get chrome and aluminium.  With your new MV electrolyser you are able to do all these recipes.

questDatabase.name: MV Batteries
questDatabase.description: Better machines need some better batteries. Let's make some MV battery hulls for new batteries. Now it's up to you to make lithium, cadmium, sodium or acid batteries with these hulls.

questDatabase.name: Plastic out of Bio Mass
questDatabase.description: You found out that making plastic out of biomass is easier than making it out of naptha.

questDatabase.name: Clay Electrolyzing
questDatabase.description: You found out that clay is a very good source for electrolysing silicon out of it. There are plenty of stained clay blocks found in canyon biomes or on mountains.

questDatabase.name: Powder Barrels
questDatabase.description: Powderbarrels are twice better than dynamite in the implosion compressor. Craft one Stack.

questDatabase.name: TNT
questDatabase.description:
TNT is much more powerful than the powderbarrel but much harder to craft. There are a LV and a HV ways to craft. At LV you need heavy or light fuel to make some toluene wich can be solidified to gelled toluene. Alternatively you can use sugar and plastic dust in the chemical reactor to make toluene more efficient. Mix it with sulfuric acid to make TNT.

The HV way requires an oil cracking unit to make cracked light fuel and a distillation tower to extract toluene from that.

questDatabase.name: iTNT
questDatabase.description: Industrial TNT is the HV variant of TNT. It does not destroy blocks when it explodes.

questDatabase.name: Dynamit
questDatabase.description:
Dynamite is the most basic explosive you can use in the implosion compressor.
Mixing some sand, flint dust, gunpowder and a fuse in the mixer.

questDatabase.name: Time to drill!
questDatabase.description:
Pumps are nice but you're going to reach a point where you will want MOOOOOOOOOOOOORE oil. This multiblock will help with that but you will need to search for it using a seismic prospector. You can find raw, light and heavy oil. There's also  a chance to find Natural Gas.

Higher tiers of power will drill faster you need to upgrade the energy hatch coresponding to the power tier.

questDatabase.name: Let's get it crackin!
questDatabase.description:
Cracking oil will result in better byproducts in the distillation tower. It is a smart idea to get this multiblock since you are going to need TONS of TNT for advanced tier rockets. 

If you input steam the amout of eu/t will be reduced by 50% and if you input hydrogen the output will be increased by 30%

questDatabase.name: Analyzing the soil
questDatabase.description:
To determine which kind of oil or gas there is in the chunk you need to scan the soil by right clicking the seismic prospector with 8 dynamite, 4 TNT, 2 ITNT or 1 glyceryl. Then use a data stick to extract the data by right clicking on it after the animation has finished.
ProTip: you can do it more efficiently by scanning every 6 chunks. 

Now you need to add the analyzed data stick to a scanner. Then place it in the bottom right slot of the printer and add 3 paper in the top left slot and make sure you have atleast 144 mb squid ink in it. (Only Gregtech machines will work)

After the process is done take the printed page and combine it with a piece of leather in an assembler filled with at least 20 mb of refined glue. 

TADA now you have a book with info about the chunk you scanned.

questDatabase.name: You smell like a Distillery
questDatabase.description:
This bad boy will tremendously boost the byproducts of your cracked fuel by multiplying them by 5. This way you can make ITNT, polyethylene, polytetrafluoroethyline and other plastics more efficiently. 

You will also need this for your automated setups.

questDatabase.name: Playing with dust
questDatabase.description: This machine will help you turn dust into crystals wich you will need for high tier recipes.

questDatabase.name: Avengers, Assemble! 2
questDatabase.description: You know what this does. :D

questDatabase.name: Dust to crystals
questDatabase.description: Using the Autoclave to crystalize your Dust. You can make raw Carbon mesh out of Carbon dust.

questDatabase.name: Precision is required
questDatabase.description: You will use this a lot to make high tier circuits and for other recipes

questDatabase.name: Way one: Raw carbon mesh
questDatabase.description: This way of making carbon requires autoclaveing 4 carbon dust, you can use Polyethylene wich give you only 1 raw carbon fibre  at LV Tier, Polytetrafluoroethylene gives you 2 at MV Tier or the best way Molted Epoxis with 4 at HV Tier.

questDatabase.name: Way two: Bio Organic Mesh
questDatabase.description:
If you like to save the ecosystem you can autoclave 16 Plantballs to get Raw Bio Fiber with the following liquids:

-Biomass 33% chance
-Biogas 50% chance
-Fuel 90% chance
-NitroDiesel 100% chance

However making carbon plates this way will require an EBF (ElectricBlastFurnace)

questDatabase.name: Carbon parts
questDatabase.description: Those are the first parts you will need for your beloved Nano Armor.

questDatabase.name: Seeing things brighter
questDatabase.description: The nano helemet is a bit special it will provide you Night Vision as long as you have energy!

questDatabase.name: Are those green diamonds?
questDatabase.description: They may not be green diamonds but they are needed for your nano armor.

questDatabase.name: Carbon Plates
questDatabase.description: Carbon Plates are needed for the Nano Armor. Go check out the Armor Chapter.

questDatabase.name: Carbon skin
questDatabase.description: You can stop worring about some mobs for now this will help you survive a bit and will give you some of that SWAG, your journey doesn't stop here Quantum Armor awaits you traveller!

questDatabase.name: Organic Way
questDatabase.description: Bio Carbon Plates are made out of Raw Carbon Mesh. Put it in The Electric Blast Furnace to make them to Carbon Plates.

questDatabase.name: Still not enough charcoal?
questDatabase.description: Now that you have a vacuum freezer and you have the possibility of manufacturing Kanthal, it's time to build a Pyrolyse Oven. This oven is the best way to get charcoal and creosote (x50 faster than Railcraft's Coke Oven). You will need tons of bronze, iron and steel to build it, but it's worth it. Finally, it will be possible to dismantle the charcoal pit.

questDatabase.name: We need big toys
questDatabase.description: Your little turbines take up very much space? It is time to solve this problem. This large turbine can help you produce a tremendous amount of energy. Don't forget to make a rotor for the turbine. At the initial stage is the most suitable material for the rotor is: vanadium steel (has a very high durability, but slowly produces energy), cobalt (good combination of durability and performance) and ultimet (has higher efficiency, durability and performance).

questDatabase.name: It's time to get more steam
questDatabase.description: As soon as you have the ability to store energy in large quantities, it would be necessary to have a way to generate energy in large quantities. This will help you a Large Bronze Boiler. But in order to make this boiler, need a mountain of bronze. Are you not thrown out your old bronze blast furnace? Boldly casting it in an Arc Furnace and get back your bronze! You will also need ten basic steam turbines, as boiler produces 800 liters of steam per tick, and the turbine consumes 80.

questDatabase.name: Steam is never enough
questDatabase.description: Now, you can make advanced circuits, which means it's time to build a Large Steel Boiler. This boiler is one and a half times more efficient than a bronze one, and that means we need 5 more steam turbines. Don't forget to monitor the water level!

questDatabase.name: Moooooore steam
questDatabase.description: Stock up on titanium, it will be fun. Large Titanium Boiler produces 1600 litres of steam per tick. For this amount you need to choose the right rotors for your turbines. For example, 2 normal cobalt rotors will be just right. Optimal flow for such rotor is 800 liters per tick. If you have more than one boiler, you will need to make calculations in order to select the appropriate rotors.

questDatabase.name: Even more steam? Are you sure?
questDatabase.description: This boiler is the most efficient source of steam. It allows you to produce as much as 2000 litres of steam per tick. If you need more, then build dual or even quad boiler.

questDatabase.name: Energy Crystals
questDatabase.description: Making Energy Crystals out of Ruby and Redstone Dusts. Energy Crystals can store 1 Million EU.

questDatabase.name: Nano Crystal
questDatabase.description: This Nano Crystals are used for making the Nano Armor.

questDatabase.name: Don't look in the eyes!
questDatabase.description: Bad things may happen if this creature is allowed to stay alive. And the Ores in the cave are valuable anyway.

questDatabase.name: I don't even...
questDatabase.description: Ok so there is this Maze. And there are... Minotaurs. But what in the world is a Minoshroom?

questDatabase.name: A big ugly snake
questDatabase.description: Required for your first wand and in general, an ugly creature.

questDatabase.name: Adventure time!
questDatabase.description: Stop him before he makes his wish at Prismos'!

questDatabase.name: Who you're gonna call?
questDatabase.description: Phantom Busters! Or wait... Ah whatever. They drop good armor by the way.

questDatabase.name: The big fluffy crybaby
questDatabase.description: It flies, it makes funny sounds, and .. IT'S SO FLUFFY! Well, kill it.

questDatabase.name: Let her go
questDatabase.description: It seems the cold doesn't bother her. Comitted crimes: None. But... you know... you have to progress somehow...

questDatabase.name: Yeti. Alpha, Yeti.
questDatabase.description: Wanted: Alpha Yeti. Death. Committed crimes: Throwing ice at people, violently for no reason.

questDatabase.name: Secret: A nice....
questDatabase.description: Hey, you! I want that lamp. I have something for you in return. You don't need it anyways, do you?

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Creeper)
questDatabase.description: That Who hasn't experienced that yet... You think nothing evil, mine a few Diamonds, and suddenly, you wake up in your bed, all your items gone. Time to strike back!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Pigman)
questDatabase.description: "Zombie Pigman"? What the hell is going on with you Zombies! Maybe you should encase your Animals better at night...

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Spiders)
questDatabase.description: Eeeek! Wall climbing monsters, gross! Slay them. Quickly!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Skeleton)
questDatabase.description: Arrows are nice, if you shoot them. If one hits you, well, bad things happen. (Hint: Arrows are an excellent source of Telum)

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Blaze)
questDatabase.description: You should be careful with this task. Fire protection is highly recommended.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Zombie)
questDatabase.description: Nobody knows who they are, or where they came from. They're just annoying a night, and too stupid to make a crafting table.

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Enderman)
questDatabase.description: Uh, fancy teleport pearls. You need them. All of them. Now!

questDatabase.name: Time to kill (Wither)
questDatabase.description: After collection a couple of those WitherSkeleton heads, you feel like you could need some more action. So why not kill a Wither? You'll need a ton of Netherstars anyway...

questDatabase.name: Secret: The trade for life
questDatabase.description: You have been busy my friend. I have something for you. Give me your hearts, and I will magically enhance them so you can actually use those.

questDatabase.name: Skeleton: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In Order to advance to a higher tier and reach Mars, Deimos and Phobos, you need to make yourself a better rocket. There are rumors, that an evolved Skeleton has Schematics of such a device.

questDatabase.name: Creeper: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Not that regular creepers are nasty enough, no. There is an Evolved Creeper Boss! He is your key (Well he HAS a key...) to reach the next tier of planets (Asteroid Belt, Ceres, Io, Europa, Ganymede, Callisto).

questDatabase.name: Blaze: Evolved
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed to Tier 4 Planets, the Blaze Boss needs to be killed. Find him in one of the Dungeons on Ceres.

questDatabase.name: Ghast: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Fluffy, fluffier, Ghasts! And also big crybabies. This one hides in a dungeon on IO, and holds the Key for Tier 5 Planets.

questDatabase.name: Crystal Boss: Ayyy.. Wait, what?
questDatabase.description: Seriously, a Crystal Boss? Anyway, it's your key to Tier 6 Planets, and he lurks around on Enceladus.

questDatabase.name: Slime: Evolved
questDatabase.description: Totally looks like a Thaumic Slime to me. Don't you think so? Find this dude on Proteus.

questDatabase.name: Wolf:Evolved
questDatabase.description: The final frontier... A... wolf that is not even an Iron Maiden fan?... What did you expect, a super Boss? Heh. No. Budget was too tight...

questDatabase.name: Technology: Evolved
questDatabase.description: You beat the game, literally. There is nothing left to do, you might want to try real life... But one thing might be interesting for you. You know, just for the phuns. Select one of the totally OP items here.

Lore:9: This! Is OP

questLines.name: Tier 0 - It begins
questLines.description: The very first Tier, Tier zero. This chapter will introduce you to the basic mechanics of this modpack. Mods covered: Vanilla, Pam's Harvestcraft.

questLines.name: Tier 0.5 - Stone Age
questLines.description: Basically the "Tier 0" of all your progression. This set helps you through the first tier until you can build your first steam machine

questLines.name: Tier 1 - Steam
questLines.description: Quest set for all steam-based machines.

questLines.name: Tier 2 - 32 EU (LV)
questLines.description: The first "Voltage" Tier of this pack. Things are getting easier...

questLines.name: Tier 3 - 128 EU (MV)
questLines.description: Your second voltage tier. Don't mix different voltage levels, or you will be punished in a hard way.

questLines.name: Tier 4 - 512 EU (HV)
questLines.description: Finally some power to work with. This tier will help you prepare to reach distant planets and gather more rare resources to build even more advanced machines.

questLines.name: Tier 5 - 2048 EU (EV)
questLines.description: Titanium-Level, fissile energy sources, Applied Energistics 2.

questLines.name: Tier 6 and beyond
questLines.description: The last regular tier that will "guide" you

questLines.name: Forestry and Farms
questLines.description: Automated Farms and more.....

questLines.name: Novice Thaumaturge
questLines.description: Magic lies beyond. Great achievements, but also a lot of work. I shall be your guide. Follow my instructions, and you shall become a great Wizard, like me.

questLines.name: Adept Thaumaturgy
questLines.description: Warp included.

questLines.name: Kaaami, Haaaami, ... HA!
questLines.description: Ultimate (magical) POWER!!!

questLines.name: Alternative Magic
questLines.description: What kind of witchery is this!?

questLines.name: Multiblock Goals
questLines.description: This set is a global tracker for multiblock goals structures. As you can build several parts of many multiblocks way earlier than the respective tier.

questLines.name: Armor's and Jetpack's
questLines.description: Guiding you through the Armous or Jetpacs.

questLines.name: Cooking Farming Fishing
questLines.description: Cooking Basic and more advanced Food

questLines.name: Transportation
questLines.description: All kinds of Transportation means

questLines.name: Legendary Quests
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Legendary Tier X
questLines.description: A legendary quest-line with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Legendary Infinity
questLines.description: A legendary questline with difficult tasks, expensive recipes and potentially dangerous locations. Are you prepared?

questLines.name: Paying the highest price
questLines.description: When regular magic just won't cover it, pay demons to do it for you! The cost might scare some people... But no risk no fun!

questLines.name: More blood, more stuff
questLines.description: Advanced Blood Magic? My veins feel weird...

questLines.name: They are coming...
questLines.description: The spirits that I've called... Demon invasions and beyond. Really deep into dark magic!

questLines.name: Kill all the things
questLines.description: This world is full of nasty things. Time to kill some and improve your reputation.

questLines.name: How to be(e)
questLines.description: An non-tiered quest set that is meant as an in game, quest based tutorial and guide to bees. Since they are a really helpful tool to advance forward.

questLines.name: To grind, or not to grind
questLines.description: That is the question. Do you want good tools? Well, then go grind stuff! The rewards of these quests are worth it, trust me.

questLines.name: Reward Area
questLines.description: Upgrade your loot bags!
